annotation_sentence: It come... um, how to say... it is not all time.
rationale: The verb 'come' should be in the present tense 'comes' to agree with the present tense 'is' in the sentence.

annotation_sentence: When I eat, it become more... uh, strong, more painful.

annotation_sentence: No travel, but I eat new restaurant last week.

annotation_sentence: Yes, I take, um, painkiller, but it not help much.
